title: A1466 820-00165-A no power
message:
Hi,

I have an A1466 820-00165-A that has no power.

It tries to power on (goes to 350mA, and drops to 25mA), but doesn't power on.

The region arround U1950 was corroded and I ireplaced U1950 and R8167 but without success.

On U1950 I get 3.4V on PP3V42_G3H but 0V on ALL_SYS_PWRGD.

Can you help?

title: A1466 820-00165-A no power
message:
No pulse at all at ALL_SYS_PWRGD?
Remove Q8150 and check again.

title: A1466 820-00165-A no power
message: I get a pulse of 2.8V, but immediately drops to 0V

title: A1466 820-00165-A no power
message:
Pin 3 of U1950 pulse at same time?
If not, remove U1950 and check for corrosion.
If yes, check for pulse at PLT_RESET_L too.

title: A1466 820-00165-A no power
message:
I have pulses on pin3 of U1950 and on  PLT_RESET_L too.
I already replaced U1950, and cleaned the pads (no corrosion).

title: A1466 820-00165-A no power
message:
"Remove Q8150 and check again."
Did that?

Also try SMC bypass.
Check all SPI Bus Termination resistros and their traces; clean J6100 too.
Try known good BIOS.

title: A1466 820-00165-A no power
message:
HI,

I did removed Q8150, but with the same result. Now I've soldered it again.
SMC bypass didn''t worked either.
All SPI Bus Termination resistors are ok.
J6100  is clean and with no corrosion.
With a clean ME BIOS, the same result.

title: A1466 820-00165-A no power
message:
Then probably bad CPU.
You can try heating it with quality flux; maybe just accumulated crap.

title: A1466 820-00165-A no power
message:
OK, tks.
What temp and heat time do you recommend?

title: A1466 820-00165-A no power
message: 180-200 C degrees, no more than 15-20s...

title: A1466 820-00165-A no power
message: TKS!

title: A1466 820-00165-A no power
message: Before I heat the CPU (haven't done it yet), I took a look in the thermal cam, and the only thing that gets hot is the area arround U7100, and it seams that C7150 gets a bit hotter (not shorted and has 8,59V on both pins), and the U4650 area was a bit corroded (already cleaned it). Do you think that this mean something related with the problem?

title: A1466 820-00165-A no power
message:
After heating the CPU, and making a ultra sound cleaning, now i don't have PP5V_S5 (0V).
Any idea?

title: A1466 820-00165-A no power
message:
After heating the CPU and making an ultra-sound, now I don't get PP5V_S4RS3 (0V), but I have PP5_S5
Any idea?

title: A1466 820-00165-A no power
message:
Seems that you make use of UC more than needed.
At least test the boards before the process.

I suspect knocked off components, or broken trace.
Also possible CPU damaged, if overheated.

title: A1466 820-00165-A no power
message:
Tks for the tip about UC. I've done it because of the CPU flux (I've used a lot).
I don't think that I've overheated the CPU (but not sure), and I can't see broken components.
Any idea of the major traces that I should look for?

title: A1466 820-00165-A no power
message: Try reballing SMC, as last option...

title: A1466 820-00165-A no power
message:
I've rebaled SMC but same result. It tries to power on (no fan spin), goes to 0.350mA, and drops to 0.25mA.

I have 0V on  PP5V_S4RS3  and 0V on  PP5V_S0. 

On PP3V3_S5 I get 3.3V but on PP3V3_S4 I only get 0.324V.

Do you think that is the CPU?

title: A1466 820-00165-A no power
message: Very likely bad PCH/CPU...

title: A1466 820-00165-A no power
message: OK. TKS.
